thread.title_full: Two Vehicles Damaged in Shots Fired Investigation in Carbondale, Police Seek Information | Illinois | wsiltv.com

author: : Mike Mohundro
title: Two Vehicles Damaged in Shots Fired Investigation in Carbondale, Police Seek Information | Illinois | wsiltv.com
text:
CARBONDALE, Ill. -- Police in Carbondale are looking for information in regards to a shots fired call where two vehicles were reportedly damaged.
The Carbondale Police Department stated the incident happened on the night of April 24. Officers responded to the 500-block of S. Rawlings Street for a shots fired report around 9:10 p.m.
When officers got there, police said the suspects already left the area.
Police started investigating and noted a silver car left the area going north on South Rawlings Street at the time of the reported incident.
No injuries were reported from the shots fired call, however, there were two vehicles damaged by gunfire, police said. One vehicle was found damaged in the area of the shots fired call, while the other vehicle was later found damaged and abandoned in the 400-block of West Elm Street.
The investigation is ongoing.
Anyone with information about the incident is encouraged to contact the City of Carbondale Police Department at (618) 549-2121. You may also call the Carbondale/SIU Crime Stoppers anonymous tip line at (618) 549-COPS (2677) or the Murphysboro/Jackson County anonymous tip line at (618) 687-COPS (2677).
